Build ID: eclipse 3.3

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Have a custom editor in the view that does not use an IPostSelectionProvider for its selectionprovider
2. Open the JPA View
3. An exception will occur in TextEditorSelectionProvider

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.jboss.tools.common.editor.SelectionNotifier

	at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.TextEditorSelectionParticipant.<init>(TextEditorSelectionParticipant.java:48)

	at org.eclipse.jpt.ui.internal.selection.SelectionParticipantFactory.getAdapter(SelectionParticipantFactory.java:30)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AdapterFactoryProxy.getAdapter(AdapterFactoryProxy.java:61)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AdapterManager.getAdapter(AdapterManager.java:277)

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.util.Util.getAdapter(Util.java:115)

	at org.eclipse.ui.part.MultiPageEditorPart.getAdapter(MultiPageEditorPart.java:823)

	at org.jboss.tools.common.editor.ObjectMultiPageEditor.getAdapter(ObjectMultiPageEditor.java:557)

	at org.jboss.tools.jst.web.ui.editors.WebCompoundEditor.getAdapter(WebCompoundEditor.java:45)

More information:
Fix: 

replace any ((IPostSelectionProvider) editor.getSelectionProvider()) code with an instanceof check in TextEditorSelectionProvider.
Note: without this an error dialog with 4-5 errors comes up as soon as you us an editor that is not using a PostSelectionProvider (e.g. like the structured xml editor in jboss tools)
Changing severity to Major to reflect Major loss of function.  It would be great if you could provide a patch for this Max, but if not, we will get to it eventually for 1.0.2.
